recommendations.recommendation: Once again, we`re treated with another Gundam series where its aim is to promote the GunPla industry. Sadly, only 4 characters make a return, 3 as a regular, and 1 as a one-time appearance. The rest are new and original cast. Again, cameos will be shown in various places, or references thereof. And those wanting absolute confirmation, the answer is at the final episode, despite being continuously implied. If you`ve seen or liked at least one Gundam series (one that isn`t Build Fighters or related), then this series is recommended. Highly recommended for GunPla fans in general.

Very weakly executed anime this time. Took the same formula from Gundam Build Fighters and re-applied it here. The previous series is already simple enough and this story line is even simpler and more predictable.

anime.description: Seven years have passed since http://anidb.net/ch57667 [Iori Sei] won the 7th Gunpla Battle Championship World Tournament. The Gunpla Battle Championship is now run by Yajima Trading. With new rules and battle modes, the game`s popularity has become even more widespread. However, the Seiho Academy that Iori Sei once attended has failed to catch onto the trend. The only member of the school`s Gunpla Battle Club is its president, middle-schooler http://anidb.net/ch68684 [Hoshino Fumina]. Currently there is no way the club can participate in the middle an high-school division of the upcoming All-Japan Gunpla Battle Championship, where players fight in teams of three. Then Fumina meets a new transfer student. He is http://anidb.net/ch68681 [Kamiki Sekai], a young martial artist who has been traveling with his master. Together with a young Gunpla builder named http://anidb.net/ch68683 [Kousaka Yuuma], they finally have three members for their team. Kamiki Sekai, Kousaka Yuuma, and Hoshino Fumino - Team TRY FIGHTERS is about to begin its challenge! Source: Official Website

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kousaka China
character.description: China is a first year student at the middle school section of the Seifuu Private Academy, class president, and member of the art club. Her home is the restaurant Kousaka. As she watches http://anidb.net/ch57667 [Sei] get interested in Gundam plastic model battles, she herself becomes intrigued with the sport. She has a wise and reserved personality. Her chest is also "reserved." Source: ANN

character.name: MS-06R-AB Zaku Amazing
character.description: A Gunpla built by Seiho Academy student government president Yuuki Tatsuya, also known as the Crimson Comet. Tatsuya`s building and piloting skills combine to create an unbeatable foe. Based on the MSV High Mobility Model Zaku II, it`s also been unarmored and equipped with fixed weaponry. Its mix between ranged and melee power make it a potent contender on any battleground. Source: Official Website

character.name: Ral-san
character.description: A regular customer of the model store owned by Sei`s family. Aside from the fact that he adores the mobile suit Gouf, everything else about him is unknown, including his full name, birthplace, family status, and occupation. For some reason, many of the characters address him as Lieutenant. Source: Official Website

character.name: Allan Adams
character.description: A young engineer who belongs to the PPSE Gunpla Works division of PPSE, the company that has monopoly control of the Plavsky particle generation system. As a Gunpla builder, his abilities are also at the world`s highest level. Source: Official Website

character.name: Meijin Kawaguchi
character.description: A Gunpla builder who became famous when Gundam plastic models were first released. His works were praised as being made by the hand of God, and he was singled out as a Meijin. The Meijin`s title was handed down through the generations, and Yuuki Tatsuya is now the third to inherit the Kawaguchi name. Source: Official Website

character.name: PPMS-18E Kampfer Amazing
character.description: A customized version of a mobile suit from MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM 0080: WAR IN THE POCKET. This is a works model created through the full efforts of the researchers at PPSE, which runs Gunpla Battle. Its back and legs can be equipped with container binders that hold all kinds of weapons. Source: Official Website

character.name: Kamiki Sekai
character.description: A second-year student who has transferred to Seiho Academy middle school, and a master of the Jigen Haoh school of martial arts. Sekai`s encounter with Hoshino Fumina introduces him to Gunpla Battle, leading him to discover how enjoyable and deep it can be. Source: Official Website

character.name: Kamiki Mirai
character.description: A second year student at Seiho Academy senior high school, and Sekai`s big sister. Mirai is beautiful enough to work as an amateur model for fashion magazines. She watches affectionately over her brother as he is drawn into Gunpla Battle. Source: Official Website

character.name: Kousaka Yuuma
character.description: A second-year student at Seiho Academy middle school, and younger brother of Kousaka China. Yuuma is a gifted young Gunpla builder, with enough talent to win the Grand Prix in a modeling tournament`s Artistic Gunpla Contest. Source: Official Website

character.name: Hoshino Fumina
character.description: A third-year student at Seiho Academy middle school. Fumina is president of the Gunpla Battle Club, and is busy trying to collect members for her club, so that they can compete in the middle and high-school division of the Championship. Source: Official Website

character.name: BG-011B Build Burning Gundam
character.description: The Gunpla used by Kamiki Sekai. Its level of completion is very high, and it can be controlled with ease even by Gunpla Battle beginners such as Sekai. The Build Burning Gundam excels in melee combat, where Sekai can make use of his Jigen Haoh school martial arts techniques. Source: Official Website

character.name: LGZ-91 Lightning Gundam
character.description: Kousaka Yuuma`s Gunpla, which has been built based on the Re-GZ from "MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM: CHAR`S COUNTERATTACK." The Back Weapon System has been improved with Yuuma`s own modifications. This Gunpla specializes in long-range shooting. Source: Official Website

character.name: Winning Gundam
character.description: An original SD Gundam Gunpla built by Hoshino Fumina for the All-Japan Gunpla Battle Championship. It makes full use of its characteristics as an SD Gundam, and is loaded with various gimmicks such as recombining transformation. Source: Official Website

character.name: RGM-237C Powered GM Cardigan
character.description: The Gunpla that Hoshino Fumina uses before the Winning Gundam. Based on the Powered GM from "MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM 0083: STARDUST MEMORY," its armament is greatly enhanced. Source: Official Website

character.name: Miyaga Daiki
character.description: A third-year student at Seiho Academy senior high school, and president of the Plastic Model Club. Daiki plans to recruit Hoshino Fumina away from the Gunpla Battle Club. He is also known as "Praying Mantis Man." Source: Official Website

character.name: Shinoda Eri
character.description: A second-year student at Seiho Academy senior high school, and vice president of the Plastic Model Club. She adores club president Miyaga, and works devotedly to support him. Source: Official Website

character.name: Sazaki Kaoruko
character.description: A third-year student at St. Odessa Academy middle school. As the younger sister of Sazaki Susumu from the previous series, she has clearly inherited her brother`s shield spirit. Her Gunpla team is called "Song Dynasty Vase." Source: Official Website

character.name: Shigure Mahiru
character.description: A student at St. Odessa Academy, and a member of the "Song Dynasty Vase" team. She has attended girls` schools since kindergarten, and as a result she has some strange ideas about boys. Source: Official Website

character.name: Sano Keiko
character.description: A student at St. Odessa Academy, and a member of the "Song Dynasty Vase" team. She likes to spend her time on the Internet, and uses a lot of net slang in her speech. Source: Official Website

character.name: Beargguy F
character.description: A variation of the Beargguy II built by Kamiki Mirai, with the help of Kousaka Yuuma. It carries a small Beargguy, the Petit-gguy, in the Chair Striker on its back. Source: Official Website

character.name: R-Gyagya
character.description: Sazaki Kaoruko`s Gunpla. This is a customized version of the R-Jarja from "MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM ZZ." The base machine inherited the Gyan`s design concept, and the R-Gyagya has been remodeled into a design even closer to that of the Gyan. Source: Official Website

character.name: Ez-SR Intruder
character.description: A customized version of the Gundam Ez8 from "MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM: THE 08th MS TEAM." It is used by Ishibashi, a member of the Science Club at the Seiren Metropolitan Technical College. Both its arms are equipped with electromagnetic knuckles. Together with the Eliminator and Shadow Phantom, it forms a team whose three members divide up their roles and crush their enemies with flawless teamwork. Source: Official Website

character.name: Ez-SR Eliminator
character.description: A customized version of the Gundam Ez8 used by Nishikawa, a member of the Science Club at the Seiren Metropolitan Technical College. It is a bombardment type equipped with a 180mm cannon and missile pod, as well as optical camouflage to conceal its body. Source: Official Website

character.name: Ez-SR Shadow Phantom
character.description: A customized version of the Gundam Ez8 used by Okamoto, a member of the Science Club at the Seiren Metropolitan Technical College. It has specialized equipment for information warfare, and when it activates its sensors, it raises the radome unit on its backpack. Source: Official Website

character.name: Sakai Minato
character.description: A middle-school builder born and raised in Osaka, and a follower of the Gunpla Shingyo school. He considers himself a rival to Kousaka Yuuma, who is famous throughout the Kanto region. His favorite drink is reiko (iced coffee). Source: Official Website

character.name: Sudou Shunsuke
character.description: The leader of team G-Master from the Miyazato Institute, which won last year`s West Tokyo Qualifiers. He loves Gunpla and the Gundam series, and even behaves like a soldier from a Gundam story. He is an old friend of Sakai Minato, an expert builder from Osaka. Source: Official Website

character.name: Sakashita Yomi
character.description: The sole female member of team G-Master from the Miyazato Institute. She has great ability as a fighter. She is normally aloof, but she can occasionally be flirtatious, too. She prefers manly men to pretty boys. Source: Official Website

character.name: Yasu Meguta
character.description: The youngest member of team G-Master from the Miyazato Institute. He has a vast knowledge of Gunpla lore, and has a complete collection of all Gashapon Warrior figures to date. Source: Official Website

character.name: Ishibashi Daigo
character.description: The president of the Science Club at Seiren Technical College, and his team`s ace. Known as the bright star of the Shipping Technology Department, his training with ocean-going ships has given him a wealth of experience and honed his body, and he is now aiming to enter the national tournament. Source: Official Website

character.name: Nishikawa Shouta
character.description: A member of the Science Club at Seiren Technical College. He is skilled in mechanical and electronic engineering, and is singlehandedly responsible for customizing his team`s Gunpla and developing new weapons. Source: Official Website

character.name: Okamoto Yukio
character.description: A member of the Science Club at Seiren Technical College. As a student of information engineering, he specializes in using his skills to gather intelligence on his team`s opponents. Source: Official Website

character.name: Mega-Shiki
character.description: A Gunpla built by Sakai Minato of the Gunpla Shingyo school. It is based on the Hyaku-Shiki from "MOBILE SUIT Z GUNDAM," as well as the machines descended from it. Its backpack can detach and function as a Megarider or Mega Launcher. Source: Official Website

character.name: Hi-Mock
character.description: An unmanned machine included with Yajima Trading`s Gunpla Battle system for use in battles against the computer. It is an improvement over the version developed by PPSE. There are several variations of this machine, and its strength in battle can be set to any desired level. Source: Official Website

character.name: XM-X1 Crossbone Gundam X-1 Full Cloth

episode.title: 風を呼ぶ少年
The Boy Who Calls the Wind
Kaze o Yobu Shounen
episode.summary: Fumina Hoshino, president of the Seiho Academy`s Gunpla Battle Club, is flustered. Since she is currently the Battle Club`s only member, it won`t be able to enter the Gunpla Battle Japanese Under-19 Championship, which requires teams of three. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Gミューズ
G-Muse
G Muse
episode.summary: Having achieved their first victory in the practice match with Gyanko, the Try Fighters are training hard for the regional qualifiers which will be held in one month. Fumina is thinking of building a new mobile suit for use in the tournament, and when she confers with Mr. Ral, he suggests that she and Sekai take a trip to G-Muse. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: その名はギャン子
Her Name Is Gyanko
Sono Na wa Gyanko
episode.summary: Yuuma`s transfer to the Gunpla Battle Club, which looked as if it would be a big problem, turns out be quick and easy. It`s almost an anticlimax when he officially joins the club, but they now meet the entry requirements for the Gunpla Battle Championship, and Fumina swiftly completes their entry with a club adviser`s help. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 結成! トライ・ファイターズ
Team Up, Try Fighters!
Kessei! Try Fighters
episode.summary: Having transferred to the Seiho Academy, Sekai discovers that he and Yuuma are in the same class. He challenges Yuuma to a battle but is bluntly rejected. Meanwhile, the school`s student council has decided to merge the Gunpla Battle Club with the Plastic Model Club. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: この盾に誓って
Upon This Shield
Kono Tate ni Chikatte
episode.summary: The Try Fighters have made it into the semifinals as one of the best four teams. A drawing is held to determine the brackets, and they are matched up with Suiryu Academy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 素組みのシモン
Straight-Assembly Shimon
Motokumi no Shimon
episode.summary: After defeating the veterans of Seiren Technical College, the Try Fighters win an easy victory in the third round, as their opponents self-destruct! With luck on their side, they are advancing to the quarterfinals. Fumina and the others observe the following match to see their next opponent. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦場の支配者
Ruler of the Battlefield
Senjou no Shihaisha
episode.summary: The Try Fighters have achieved a splendid victory in the first round of the regional qualifiers, and they celebrate with a modest toast. But their joy is short-lived as they learn who they will face in round two. Their opponent is Seiren Technical College, a veteran team which is favored to win the championship Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 憧れと挑戦を胸に
Dream and Challenge In Your Heart
Akogare to Chousen o Mune ni
episode.summary: Through the battle with Minato Sakai, Sekai and Fumina have realized what they need to do, and they quickly begin working towards the championship. Meanwhile, in order to keep his promise to Fumina, Yuuma is building power-up equipment for his Lightning Gundam. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未来へ羽ばたくために
To Fly to the Future
Mirai e Habataku Tame ni
episode.summary: The Try Fighters have been utterly defeated by Gundam The End, the Gunpla controlled by Saga Adou of the Gunpla Academy. Yuuma is unable to hide his shock at witnessing the vast difference in their abilities, and he flees the scene, leaving his teammates behind. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニールセン・ラボ
Nielsen Labs
Nielsen Lab
episode.summary: Now that their end-of-term exams are over, the Try Fighters are going to a training camp to prepare for the national tournament which will take place during summer vacation. Mr. Ral has kindly arranged for them to visit the Nielsen Labs, a facility equipped with the industry`s leading battle environment. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガン☆コレ
Gunpla Collection
Gun Colle
episode.summary: The Try Fighters have won the West Tokyo qualifying tournament for the Gunpla Battle Japanese Championship. As Sekai recovers from the damage of assimilation, he thinks ahead to the powerful new opponents gathering at the national tournament. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦のソロモン
Showdown at Solomon
Kessen no Solomon
episode.summary: The Try Fighters` opponent in the final round will be last year`s regional champion, team G-Master from the Miyazato Institute. The two teams prepare for the final battle, each with their own resolve and desires. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ビヨンド・ザ・ナックル
Beyond the Knuckle
Beyond the Knuckle
episode.summary: Having recovered from his battle with Adou, Sekai heads for the Labs` workshop to repair the Build Burning Gundam, and encounters a mysterious girl. Thanks to the girl`s advice, Sekai finishes repairing the Build Burning, and the next day he goes to the Labs` battle room with Mr. Ral for special training. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 華麗なるシア
Magnificent Shia
Karei Naru Shia
episode.summary: Minato Sakai and his teammates from Tendaiji Academy, representing Osaka, easily make it through the first round of the tournament thanks to the overwhelming power of their unique Gunpla, the Tryon 3. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新生! トライ・ファイターズ
Reborn Try Fighters
Shinsei! Try Fighters
episode.summary: Once upon a time, the Gunpla Battle world championship was held at the PPSE Stadium. After the Plavsky particle accident seven years ago, the damaged stadium was demolished, and a monument was placed there bearing the names of previous champions. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 好敵手たち
Worthy Rivals
Koutekishu-tachi
episode.summary: During a Battle Royal among representatives from each school under the Meijin`s supervision, Sekai Kamiki and Wilfrid Kijima have acknowledged each other as rivals, and they promise to fight again at the national tournament. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 折れない心
Unbreakable Heart
Orenai Kokoro
episode.summary: In the quarterfinals of the Gunpla Battle Japanese Championship, the showdown between Sekai Kamiki and Junya Inose, who are both students of the Jigen Haoh school of kenpo, has reached ferocious heights. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の再会
Fateful Reunion
Unmei no Saikai
episode.summary: After receiving spare parts for the Build Burning from his sister China, Yuuma is on his way back to the lodging house when he runs into a gang of delinquents. Yuuma risks himself to protect the parts, and is saved when Sekai and the others come running over. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スナイバル・ドラゴ・ギラ
Snibal-Drago-Gira
Snibal-Drago-Gira
episode.summary: The Try Fighters have been cornered by the Snibal-Drago-Gira which Toshiya Shiki created out of his grudge towards the Gunpla Academy. This monster now threatens them with its clever tactics, and the firepower it has gained by stealing their own particles with its Absorb System. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 亡霊城の罠
Haunted Castle Trap
Boureijou no Wana
episode.summary: In the second round of the tournament, the Try Fighters will be facing team SD-R from Toritsu Academy, representing Niigata. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ファイナル・バースト
Final Burst
Final Burst
episode.summary: The final round of the Gunpla Battle Japanese Championship tournament has finally begun. Taking the initiative, the Try Fighters opt to fight inside a space colony. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ビルド・ファイター
Build Fighter
Build Fighter
episode.summary: The teams advancing to the final round of the Gunpla Battle Japanese Under-19 Championship are the Try Fighters, who have narrowly defeated Minato Sakai`s team Build Busters, and Celestial Sphere from the private Gunpla Academy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心のままに
Follow Your Heart
Kokoro no Mama ni
episode.summary: At the end of the fierce first match of the Gunpla Battle Japanese Championship semifinals, the private Gunpla Academy has managed to achieve a narrow victory. The defeated Lucas Nemesis apologizes to Sekai because they won’t be able to fight in the final round. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蒼き翼
Blue Wings
Aoki Tsubasa
episode.summary: The members of the best 4 teams in the Gunpla Battle Japanese Championship gather, and a drawing is held to determine the brackets for the semifinals. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 僕たちのガンプラ
Our Gunpla
Bokutachi no Gunpla
episode.summary: The final round of the Gunpla Battle Japanese Championship`s national tournament has ended in a victory for the Try Fighters. After the finals, Sekai suddenly leaves on a training trip. Source: crunchyroll
